intro: Malveopsis leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Malveopsis leptophylla is often found in sandy or well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
